metadata.Title: CVE-2022-42920 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: Apache Commons BCEL has a number of APIs that would normally only allow changing specific class characteristics. However, due to an out-of-bounds writing issue, these APIs can be used to produce arbitrary bytecode. This could be abused in applications that pass attacker-controllable data to those APIs, giving the attacker more control over the resulting bytecode than otherwise expected. Update to Apache Commons BCEL 6.6.0.

criterions.comment: bcel: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
